oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Baker-Himel parade postcard, 1907
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: JET [James E. Thompson]
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Postcard printed caption: ‘Third Regiment N.C.S.T. band and Baker-Himel students passing [Knox County, TN] Court House. Baker-Himel school stood 96 dry and 4 wet’. (Handwritten note: ’ =100.’ ‘ Studio - X-hall door. Notice piano in ball room 2nd floor.’ ‘This is interesting showing some street corner or other. The wrecked building is Woman’s Bldg where my studio was.’ Real photo postcard (RPPC) . Postmarked Nov. 1, 1907. Temperance parade was March 1907. Addressed to Clyde O. DeLand, Philadelphia, PA. Taken at the corner of Main Street and Gay Street, Knoxville, TN. Destroyed building in background was the Woman’s Building which burned December 26, 1906 (streetcar barn later occupied that site). Frank Carpenter, Livery, Board & Sales, Stables signs on building to left of ruins. Also pictured: Magnolia streetcar, parade with band members and school group with sign.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Postcards; Events; Temperance; Parades & processions; Bands; Schools; Street railroads;
